TITLE: Blockchain API Base Endpoint Structure
DESCRIPTION: Shows the base URL structure for accessing different blockchain APIs including Bitcoin, Ethereum, Ripple and other chains. Parameter placeholders indicate which blockchain networks are supported for each endpoint type.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API_DOCUMENTATION_EN.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
{:btc_chain} can be: bitcoin, bitcoin-cash, litecoin, bitcoin-sv, dogecoin, dash, groestlcoin, zcash, ecash, or bitcoin/testnet
{:eth_chain} can be ethereum or ethereum/testnet
{:xrp_chain} can be only ripple
{:xlm_chain} can be only stellar
{:xmr_chain} can be only monero
{:ada_chain} can be only cardano
{:xin_chain} can be only mixin
{:xtz_chain} can be only tezos
{:eos_chain} can be only eos
{:xchain_token} can be tether, usd-coin, or binance-usd
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using API Key with Blockchair API Endpoints
DESCRIPTION: Examples of how to properly append an API key to Blockchair API endpoints using either the '?key=' parameter for requests without other parameters or '&key=' for requests with existing parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API_DOCUMENTATION_EN.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
https://api.blockchair.com/bitcoin/dashboards/block/0?key=myfirstpasswordwas4321andifeltsmartaboutit

https://api.blockchair.com/bitcoin/dashboards/block/0?limit=0&key=myfirstpasswordwas4321andifeltsmartaboutit

https://api.blockchair.com/bitcoin/dashboards/block/0?key=myfirstpasswordwas4321andifeltsmartaboutit&limit=0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Making a Basic API Request with curl in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Example of a basic API request to the Blockchair API using curl to retrieve the sum of bitcoin block generation rewards. The request is made via HTTPS GET to api.blockchair.com.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API_DOCUMENTATION_EN.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
> curl 'https://api.blockchair.com/bitcoin/blocks?a=sum(generation)'
{"data":[{"sum(generation)":1800957104497237}],"context":{"code":200,"source":"A","time":0.007825851440429688,"limit":10000,"offset":null,"rows":1,"pre_rows":1,"total_rows":1,"state":600767,"cache":{"live":true,"duration":60,"since":"2019-10-23 21:33:00","until":"2019-10-23 21:34:00","time":null},"api":{"version":"2.0.38","last_major_update":"2019-07-19 18:07:19","next_major_update":null,"documentation":"https:\/\/github.com\/Blockchair\/Blockchair.Support\/blob\/master\/API.md","notice":"Beginning July 19th, 2019 all applications using Blockchair API on a constant basis should apply for an API key (mailto:info@blockchair.com)"}}}
```

TITLE: Broadcasting Transactions to Blockchain Networks
DESCRIPTION: This endpoint allows broadcasting a transaction to various blockchain networks supported by Blockchair. It accepts a raw transaction in hex format and returns the transaction hash if successful, or an error message if the transaction is invalid.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API_DOCUMENTATION_EN.md#2025-04-23_snippet_98

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
  "data": {
    "transaction_hash": "0e3e2357e806b6cdb1f70b54c3a3a17b6714ee1f0e68bebb44a74b1efd512098"
  },
  "context": {
  	"code": 200
  }
}
```

TITLE: Pushing Raw Transaction to Blockchain
DESCRIPTION: Endpoint to submit a raw transaction to the network. Now supports both POST and GET methods and returns detailed error descriptions for malformed transactions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_44

LANGUAGE: HTTP
CODE:
```
https://api.blockchair.com/{:chain}/push/transaction
```

TITLE: Querying Ethereum ERC-721 NFT Stats and Transfers
DESCRIPTION: API endpoints for retrieving ERC-721 (NFT) statistics and transfers on Ethereum. Includes endpoints for global stats, transaction-specific transfers, address token holdings, contract dashboards, and token inventories.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
https://api.blockchair.com/ethereum/stats
https://api.blockchair.com/ethereum/dashboards/transaction/{:hash}?erc_721=true
https://api.blockchair.com/ethereum/dashboards/address/{:address}?erc_721=true
https://api.blockchair.com/ethereum/erc-721/{:address}/stats
https://api.blockchair.com/ethereum/erc-721/{:address}/inventory
```

TITLE: Checking Multi-Blockchain Address Dashboard
DESCRIPTION: API endpoint that checks addresses across multiple blockchains simultaneously. Supports all Bitcoin-like blockchains and Ethereum with a maximum of 100 addresses per request.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_37

LANGUAGE: HTTP
CODE:
```
https://api.blockchair.com/multi/dashboards/addresses/{:address}₀,...,{:address}ᵩ
```

TITLE: Extended Public Key API Endpoint
DESCRIPTION: HTTP endpoint for retrieving information about extended public keys (xpub, ypub, or zpub) including derived addresses and balances.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API_DOCUMENTATION_EN.md#2025-04-23_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
https://api.blockchair.com/{:btc_chain}/dashboards/xpub/{:extended_key}
```

TITLE: Example Address API Request
DESCRIPTION: Example HTTP request for retrieving information about the Genesis block Bitcoin address.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API_DOCUMENTATION_EN.md#2025-04-23_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
https://api.blockchair.com/bitcoin/dashboards/address/1A1zP1eP5QGefi2DMPTfTL5SLmv7DivfNa
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Iterating through Address Transactions in Blockchair API
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to iterate through transactions for a specific address using limit and offset parameters. This allows paginating through large transaction histories.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_67

LANGUAGE: url
CODE:
```
api.blockchair.com/{:chain}/dashboards/address/{:address}?limit=100,0&offset=100,0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fetching Multiple Address Balances in Bitcoin-like Chains
DESCRIPTION: New endpoint to fetch balances for multiple addresses (up to 25,000) in Bitcoin and similar chains. Returns only confirmed balances. Very fast and efficient.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_39

LANGUAGE: HTTP
CODE:
```
https://api.blockchair.com/{:btc_chain}/addresses/balances
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Querying Multiple Addresses in Blockchair API
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to query multiple Bitcoin addresses in a single API call using the dashboards/addresses endpoint. This allows retrieving information about multiple addresses more efficiently than making separate requests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_64

LANGUAGE: url
CODE:
```
https://api.blockchair.com/bitcoin/dashboards/addresses/1A1zP1eP5QGefi2DMPTfTL5SLmv7DivfNa,12c6DSiU4Rq3P4ZxziKxzrL5LmMBrzjrJX,1HLoD9E4SDFFPDiYfNYnkBLQ85Y51J3Zb1
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Single Address API Endpoint
DESCRIPTION: HTTP endpoint for retrieving information about a single cryptocurrency address. Supports various blockchains like Bitcoin, Bitcoin Cash, Litecoin, etc.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API_DOCUMENTATION_EN.md#2025-04-23_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
https://api.blockchair.com/{:btc_chain}/dashboards/address/{:address}₀
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving Transaction Details for Bitcoin Addresses
DESCRIPTION: API endpoint that retrieves address data with additional transaction details for Bitcoin addresses. The transaction_details option provides comprehensive information about each transaction involving the addresses.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_36

LANGUAGE: HTTP
CODE:
```
https://api.blockchair.com/bitcoin/dashboards/xpub/xpub6CUGRUonZSQ4TWtTMmzXdrXDtypWKiKrhko4egpiMZbpiaQL2jkwSB1icqYh2cfDfVxdx4df189oLKnC5fSwqPfgyP3hooxujYzAu3fDVmz?transaction_details=true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Multiple Addresses API Endpoint
DESCRIPTION: HTTP endpoint for retrieving information about multiple cryptocurrency addresses (up to 100) in a single request. Addresses should be comma-separated.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API_DOCUMENTATION_EN.md#2025-04-23_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
https://api.blockchair.com/{:btc_chain}/dashboards/addresses/{:address}₀,...,{:address}ᵩ
```

----------------------------------------

DESCRIPTION: Example HTTP request for retrieving information about two Bitcoin addresses simultaneously.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API_DOCUMENTATION_EN.md#2025-04-23_snippet_22

LANGUAGE: http

TITLE: Tracking State Changes for Multiple Addresses - Pseudocode
DESCRIPTION: Example pseudocode implementation for monitoring state changes for a large number of addresses. The code tracks both mempool and block changes, comparing against a list of target addresses to detect incoming or outgoing transactions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API_DOCUMENTATION_EN.md#2025-04-23_snippet_101

LANGUAGE: pseudocode
CODE:
```
latest_known_block_height = 0
addresses = [1Abc, 1Efg, 1Hij, ...]
while (true)
    api_response = api_request('https://api.blockchair.com/bitcoin/state/changes/mempool')
    if any of api_response.data keys are in the addresses array
        print 'Found new transaction in the mempool'
    if latest_known_block_height < api_response.context.state // A new block has been mined (context.state always yields the latest block number)
        latest_known_block_height = api_response.context.state
        api_response_block = api_request('https://api.blockchair.com/bitcoin/state/changes/block/{:api_response.context.state}')
        if any of api_response_block.data keys are in the addresses array
            print 'Found new transaction in the latest block'
    sleep(10) // The mempool data is cached for 10 seconds on our servers by default
```

TITLE: Querying Ethereum ERC-721 Token Data in Blockchair API
DESCRIPTION: API endpoints for accessing Ethereum ERC-721 non-fungible token data, including token listings and transactions. Supports filtering by token address, token ID, and time ranges with various aggregation options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: HTTP
CODE:
```
https://api.blockchair.com/ethereum/erc-721/tokens
https://api.blockchair.com/ethereum/erc-721/transactions?q=time(~P1M)&a=token_address,token_name,count()&s=count()(desc)&limit=10
https://api.blockchair.com/ethereum/erc-721/transactions?q=token_address(0xbd3531da5cf5857e7cfaa92426877b022e612cf8),token_id(5177)
https://api.blockchair.com/ethereum/erc-721/transactions?a=token_address,token_id,count()&s=count()(desc)&limit=10
```

```

TITLE: Querying Ethereum London Hard Fork Data
DESCRIPTION: API fields added to support the Ethereum London hard fork, including base fees, burned ETH, and EIP-1559 transaction fields. Includes examples for tracking burned ETH metrics.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
https://api.blockchair.com/ethereum/blocks?a=date,avg(base_fee_per_gas)&q=id(12965000..)
https://api.blockchair.com/ethereum/blocks?a=date,sum(burned_total)&q=id(12965000..)
https://api.blockchair.com/ethereum/blocks?a=date,f(sum(burned_total)/sum(generation))&q=id(12965000..)
https://api.blockchair.com/{:eth_chain}/stats
```

LANGUAGE: HTTP
CODE:

```

SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: http
CODE:
```
https://api.blockchair.com/ethereum/testnet/raw/block/{:id|hash}
https://api.blockchair.com/ethereum/testnet/raw/transaction/{:hash}
https://api.blockchair.com/ethereum/testnet/push/transaction
https://api.blockchair.com/ethereum/testnet/addresses
https://api.blockchair.com/ethereum/testnet/state/changes/block/{:id}
```

TITLE: Querying Ethereum Mempool Transactions
DESCRIPTION: API call to list Ethereum transactions included in the mempool for the last 30 seconds.

```

TITLE: Iterating through Block Transactions in Blockchair API
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to iterate through transaction hashes in a block using limit and offset parameters. This allows retrieving transactions in pages rather than all at once.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API.md#2025-04-23_snippet_66

LANGUAGE: url
CODE:
```
api.blockchair.com/{:chain}/dashboards/block/{:hash}|{:id}?limit=100&offset=0
```

```

TITLE: Using Special Aggregation Functions in Blockchair API
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates the use of special aggregation functions in the Blockchair API, including price correlation and custom expressions for calculating percentages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API_DOCUMENTATION_EN.md#2025-04-23_snippet_73

LANGUAGE: HTTP
CODE:
```
https://api.blockchair.com/bitcoin/blocks?a=month,sum(transaction_count),price(btc_usd)
```

LANGUAGE: HTTP
CODE:
```
https://api.blockchair.com/bitcoin/blocks?a=date,f(sum(witness_count)/sum(transaction_count))&q=time(2017-08-24..)
```

LANGUAGE: HTTP
CODE:
```
https://api.blockchair.com/bitcoin/outputs?a=date,f(count()/count())&q=type(nulldata),time(2019-01)&aq=0:0
```

TITLE: Output Skeleton for Infinitable Endpoint Responses
DESCRIPTION: Shows the standard JSON response structure for infinitable endpoint queries, including the data array with rows and the context object containing metadata about the query execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/API_DOCUMENTATION_EN.md#2025-04-23_snippet_70

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "data": [
    {
      ... // row 1 data
    },
    ...
    {
      ... // row 10 data
    },    
  ],
  "context": {
    "limit": 10, // the default limit of 10 is applied
    "offset": 0, // no offset has been set
    "rows": 10, // the response contains 10 rows
    "total_rows": N, // but there are N rows in the table matching {:query} (total number of rows if it's not set)
    "state": S, // the latest block number on the blockchain
    ...
  }
}
```

TITLE: Querying Genesis Blocks Across Multiple Blockchains
DESCRIPTION: SQL query example that retrieves the genesis block (id=0) information from Bitcoin, Bitcoin Cash, and Litecoin blockchains, showing block ID, hash (hex-encoded), and timestamp for each chain.
SOURCE: https://github.com/blockchair/blockchair.support/blob/master/SQL.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: SQL
CODE:
```
SELECT id, encode(hash, 'hex'), time FROM bitcoin.blocks WHERE id = 0
UNION ALL
SELECT id, encode(hash, 'hex'), time FROM bitcoincash.blocks WHERE id = 0
UNION ALL
SELECT id, encode(hash, 'hex'), time FROM litecoin.blocks WHERE id = 0;
```
